thread.title: Jeremy Corbyn to issue three-line whip to Labour MPs on Article 50 vote
thread.title_full: Jeremy Corbyn to issue three-line whip to Labour MPs on Article 50 vote

author: Ben Kentish
title: Jeremy Corbyn to issue three-line whip to Labour MPs on Article 50 vote
text:
Competitions & offers Follow us: 
We use cookies to enhance your visit to our site and to bring you advertisements that might interest you. Read our Privacy and Cookie Policies to find out more. Jeremy Corbyn to issue three-line whip to Labour MPs on Article 50 vote 
Labour leader had previously refused to say whether he would force MPs to follow party line  23 BST Click to followThe Independent Online 
Jeremy Corbyn is to issue a three-line whip to Labour MPs ahead of the parliamentary vote on Article 50, The Independent understands. 
The Labour leader has previously said he will not seek to block the triggering of the EU exit clause - and will now demand his MPs follow suit. 
The decision means several shadow ministers may have to resign in order to vote against the party line. Tulip Siddiq, the early years minister, and Catherine West, part of the foreign office team, have both said that plan to vote against Brexit. 
More follows .
